text.0:
“We've received millions of calls from all across #Pakistan.” 

A call centre in Islamabad :Pakistan: is just one example of how staff and systems from the polio programme quickly pivoted to help with Pakistan’s early #COVID19 response. https://t.co/VOD9yqX6s9
text.1:
The @FAOWHOCodex Commission adopted a new standard for canned mixed fruits :cherries::strawberry::grapes::kiwi_fruit: , to cover new combinations of mixed fruits & describing the required essential quality, hygiene and labelling requirements for the products.

:backhand_index_pointing_right: https://t.co/vYsXga7Orh https://t.co/ipL1wZaQu9
text.2:
Due to growing :globe_with_meridians: consumption, production & trade and the innovations in drying technology, @FAOWHOCodex developed an international standard for dried fruits :pineapple: to include existing standards & new products.

:backhand_index_pointing_right: https://t.co/vYsXga7Orh https://t.co/3xYIGCOBG4
text.4:
"WHO is hopeful that countries will use targeted interventions where & when needed, based on the local situation. 

We well understand the frustration that many people, communities & governments are feeling as the #COVID19 pandemic drags on, & as cases rise again"-@DrTedros
text.5:
"Many countries have used that time to develop plans, train #healthworkers, put supplies in place, increase testing capacity, reduce testing time and improve care for patients"-@DrTedros #COVID19 

https://t.co/SLYGiRVik1
text.6: "We recognize that at certain points, some countries have had no choice but to issue #StayAtHome orders & other lockdown measures, to buy time"-@DrTedros #COVID19
text.7:
"There are many tools at our disposal. WHO recommends:
-case finding
-isolation
-testing
-compassionate care
-contact tracing
-quarantine
-physical distancing
-#HandHygiene
-#WearAMask 
-respiratory etiquette
-ventilation
-avoiding crowds and more"-@DrTedros #COVID19
text.8:
"WHO is working with the @ECDC_EU to help countries evaluate the effectiveness of their digital contract tracing apps.

This is just one example of the innovative measures countries are taking to control #COVID19"-@DrTedros
text.9:
"As well as alerting users that they may have been exposed to a positive #COVID19 case, the :United_Kingdom: app allows users to book a test and receive results, keep track of the places they’ve visited and receive the latest advice on local restrictions"-@DrTedros 

https://t.co/8UnTNGY7tl
text.10:
"In :Denmark:, more than 2,700 people have been tested for 
#COVID19 as a result of notifications received through a mobile application. 

And the :United_Kingdom: has rolled out a new version of its @NHSuk  #COVID19 app, which had more than 10M downloads within the first week"-@DrTedros
text.11: "The Aarogya Setu app from :India: has been downloaded by 150M users, & has helped city public health departments to identify areas where clusters could be anticipated & expand testing in a targeted way"-@DrTedros #COVID19
text.12:
"Digital technologies are helping to make tried-&-tested public health tools even more effective, such as mobile applications to support contact tracing efforts.
:Germany:’s Corona-Warn app has been used to transmit 1.2M test results from labs to users in its first 100 days"-@DrTedros
text.13:
"This is what countries are proving works, every day"-@DrTedros #COVID19 

https://t.co/kyF9Aewf41
text.14:
"Prevent amplifying events.

Protect the vulnerable.

Empower, educate & engage communities.

Persist with the same tools that we have been advocating since day one: find, isolate, test & care for cases; trace & quarantine their contacts"-@DrTedros #COVID19
text.15: "This virus transmits mainly between close contacts and causes outbreaks that can be controlled by implementing targeted measures"-@DrTedros #COVID19
text.16:
"But we do have many options. There are many things that countries can do and are doing to control #COVID19 transmission and save lives. 

It’s not a choice between letting the virus run free and shutting down our societies"-@DrTedros
text.17:
"Allowing a dangerous virus that we don’t fully understand to run free is simply unethical. It’s not an option"-@DrTedros #COVID19 

https://t.co/FSmrMOvUJb
text.18: ":keycap_digit_three: we’re only beginning to understand the long-term health impacts among people with #COVID19. I have met with patient groups suffering with what is now being described as “Long COVID” to understand their suffering & needs so we can advance research & rehabilitation"-@DrTedros
text.19:
"Letting #COVID19 circulate unchecked therefore means allowing unnecessary infections, suffering & death.
Although :older_adult::old_man: people & those with underlying conditions are most at risk of severe disease & death, they aren't the only ones at risk. People of all ages have died"-@DrTedros
text.20: " :keycap_digit_two:the vast majority of people in most countries remain susceptible to this virus. Seroprevalence surveys suggest that in most countries, less than 10% of the population have been infected with the #COVID19 virus"-@DrTedros
text.21:
"There have also been some examples of people infected with #COVID19 being infected for a second time"-@DrTedros 

https://t.co/eWiJtXOKK5
text.22:
":keycap_digit_one: we don’t know enough about immunity to #COVID19.
Most people who are infected with the virus develop an immune response within the first few weeks, but we don’t know how strong or lasting that immune response is, or how it differs for different people"-@DrTedros
text.23: "Never in the history of public health has herd immunity been used as a strategy for responding to an outbreak, let alone a pandemic. It is scientifically and ethically problematic"-@DrTedros #COVID19
text.24:
"In other words, herd immunity is achieved by protecting people from a virus, not by exposing them to it"-@DrTedros 
#COVID19 

https://t.co/thAf05jrT3
text.25:
"For example, herd immunity against #measles requires about 95% of a population to be vaccinated. The remaining 5% will be protected by the fact that measles will not spread among those who are vaccinated. 

For #polio, the threshold is about 80%"-@DrTedros
text.26:
"There has been some discussion about the concept of reaching so-called “herd immunity” by letting the virus spread.

Herd immunity is a concept used for vaccination, in which a population can be protected from a certain virus if a threshold of vaccination is reached"-@DrTedros
text.27:
"For every country that is experiencing an increase, there are many others that have successfully prevented or controlled widespread transmission with proven measures.

Those measures continue to be our best defence against #COVID19"-@DrTedros
text.28: "Almost 70% of all #COVID19 cases reported globally last week were from 10 countries, and almost half of all cases were from just three countries"-@DrTedros
text.29:
"Many cities & countries are also reporting an increase in hospitalizations & intensive care bed occupancy.

At the same time, we must remember that this is an uneven pandemic. 

Countries have responded differently, & countries have been affected differently"-@DrTedros #COVID19
text.30:
"Around the world, we’re now seeing an increase in the number of reported cases of #COVID19, especially in Europe and the Americas.

Each of the last four days has been the highest number of cases reported so far"-@DrTedros
text.32:
The @FAOWHOCodex Commission has revised the standard for mango :mango: chutney. The original Codex Standard for Mango Chutney was developed almost 30 years ago. The revision is in line with current production & marketing practices.

:backhand_index_pointing_right: https://t.co/vYsXga7Orh https://t.co/6pbOcd3pOo
text.33:
The @FAOWHOCodex Commission has adopted global :globe_with_meridians: standards for Chili sauce & Gochujang (subject to endorsement by the food additive & labelling committees) reflecting the fact that these products are increasingly being consumed & distributed globally.

:backhand_index_pointing_right: https://t.co/vYsXga7Orh https://t.co/bXHRYGSBGf
text.34:
“Now I feel safe to come to the hospital.” - New mother Sophia, 31, from Accra :Ghana:

Around the world WHO is supporting the restoration of health services that were disrupted due to #COVID19, including at this hospital for :pregnant_woman: and :baby: in Ghana. https://t.co/IMlU2pCYhG
text.35:
What is herd immunity? 

WHO’s Chief Scientist @doctorsoumya explains the science and public health approach in #ScienceIn5

#COVID19 

https://t.co/oRJTq3oQ1Y
text.36:
"When we act out of self-interest, we provide an opportunity for the virus to spread. When we act in solidarity, the virus can be stopped.  

The stakes have never been higher. But nor has the prize: a healthier, safer, fairer & more sustainable :globe_showing_Europe-Africa:"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #ACTogether
text.37:
"The keys to defeating #COVID19 are unity and solidarity.  

That is true in families, neighbourhoods and communities, and it’s true at the regional and global level"-@DrTedros #ACTogether
text.38:
"#COVID19 will end. But we have a shared responsibility to our children & our children’s children to leave the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa: better prepared for the next pandemic.
This is a scientific & technical challenge. But more than that, it’s a test of character"-@DrTedros #ACTogether
text.39: "The #COVID19 pandemic has highlighted that healthy populations, universal health coverage and health security are inseparable"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll
text.40: "The #COVID19 pandemic has illustrated that now more than ever, investing in health is not just the right thing to do, it’s the smart thing to do"-@DrTedros
text.41: "The effects of the #COVID19 pandemic will be long-lasting and far-reaching. We still have an enormous challenge in front of us to bring this virus under control. But the even bigger challenge will be what we do after the pandemic ends"-@DrTedros
text.42:
":keycap_digit_four:, persist with the public health basics: find, isolate, test & care for cases, & trace & quarantine their contacts. 

Countries that do these :keycap_digit_four:things, & do them well, can prevent or contain widespread transmission & avoid having to reimpose so-called lockdowns"-@DrTedros
text.43:
:keycap_digit_three:educate & empower communities to protect themselves & others:
Physical distancing
#HandHygiene
Respiratory etiquette
Masks
can all help to curb #COVID19 transmission & save lives – not in isolation, but together"-@DrTedros
text.44: ":keycap_digit_two:protect the vulnerable, to save lives and reduce the burden on the health system of severely- and critically-ill patients"-@DrTedros #COVID19
text.45:
"As cases increase across the region, WHO is urging countries to focus on :keycap_digit_four:essential priorities:

:keycap_digit_one:prevent amplifying events. All around the world, explosive #COVID19 outbreaks have been linked to gatherings at stadiums, nightclubs, places of worship and other crowds"-@DrTedros
text.46:
"#COVID19 cases are increasing in the @WHO_EMRO region, and all countries must remain vigilant. The virus is still circulating and most people remain susceptible. 

Hard-won gains can be easily lost"-@DrTedros
text.47: "The #COVID19 pandemic has upended our health systems, societies & economies. Although most @WHOEMRO Member States are not among the worst-affected, your region has suffered in many ways. The social and economic consequences of the pandemic are severe"-@DrTedros
text.48: "And I offer my commitment that WHO will continue to work with you and support you to end the #COVID19 pandemic and build back better"-@DrTedros
text.49:
"I offer:
-my deep condolences to all Member States of the Eastern Mediterranean for the loss of life you have suffered during the #COVID19 pandemic
-my deep thanks & admiration to your #healthworkers, who have put themselves in harm’s way in the service of others"-@DrTedros
text.50: LIVE: @DrTedros at the @WHOEMRO 67th Regional Committee :backhand_index_pointing_down: https://t.co/PKDeICas1q
text.51: 67th Session of the Regional Committee for the Eastern Mediterranean https://t.co/rHBSAtwQbJ
